value.title: The promises and potential pitfalls of artificial intelligence in medicine
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence is finding its place in all sorts of scientific fields, and health care is no exception. Programs are learning to answer patients’ medical questions and diagnose illnesses, but there are problems to be worked out.

value.title: How the digital ad industry can guide the ways AI transforms businesses
value.excerpt: The digital advertising industry must look closely at how AI is implemented as it begins to use the tech for targeting, measurement, personalization and optimization.

value.title: Winning Customer Service Through AI And Automation In Hybrid Work Environments
value.excerpt: The way we work has been fundamentally altered by the COVID-19 pandemic, and many businesses have had to adapt to hybrid and remote work models.

value.title: Artificial Intelligence Will Eliminate Many Tasks, But Also Create New Higher-Level Ones
value.excerpt: Managers need to prepare for 'the biggest shock' coming with AI — replacing entry and low-level white-collar activities with 'first-draft automation.'

value.title: 5 ways Europe can reduce the risks of AI replacing jobs
value.excerpt: Italy has launched a new $30m fund to support workers threatened by AI. It's one of numerous responses that governments are considering.

value.title: Google at I/O 2023: We’ve been doing AI since before it was cool
value.excerpt: That Google I/O show sure was something, wasn't it? It was a rip-roaring two hours of nonstop AI talk without a break. Bard, Palm, Duet, Unicorn, Gecko, Gemini, Tailwind, Oter—there were so many cryptic AI code names thrown around it was hard to keep track of what Google was talking about.

value.title: China is using AI to raise the dead, and give people one last chance to say goodbye
value.excerpt: They wanted to speak to their dead grandparents one last time, so they used artificial intelligence to rebuild loved ones they'd lost.

value.title: AI Will Have The Most Negative Impact On Emerging Workforces
value.excerpt: AI has been around for a while, as have its many dangers. In ‘The Levelling’ we wrote about how algorithms were both causing and provoking inequalities and social injustice. value.title: Lawmakers reveal AI concerns over 'future of humanity' following OpenAI CEO's Senate testimony
value.excerpt: Displaying bias, foreign adversaries like China becoming dominant, and outsmarting humans were all top artificial intelligence concerns for members of Congress.

value.title: Schools bewildered by AI advances, say head teachers
value.excerpt: UK schools have been left confused by the fast rate of change in artificial intelligence (AI) and its impact on education, head teachers are warning. In a letter to the Times, educators from the state and private sector say developments are "bewildering".

value.title: Wall St Week Ahead Artificial intelligence gives real boost to U.S. stock market
value.excerpt: Recent advances in artificial intelligence are fueling optimism over how businesses can operate more productively in the years ahead. They are also providing a big boost to the stock market.

value.title: Procedural justice can address generative AI’s trust/legitimacy problem

value.title: The Senate’s hearing on AI regulation was dangerously friendly
value.excerpt: who is now chief ethics scientist at Hugging Face. “This would be a straightforward way to bring ‘responsible AI’ into a legal structure.” Mitchell added that good regulation depends on setting standards that firms can’t easily bend to their ...

value.title: Will AI Kill Human Creativity? What Fake Drake Tells Us About What’s Ahead
value.excerpt: In this article I’ll consider implications of AI-generated music for what I see as the inevitable creative class wars against AI, and what it means for us all.

value.title: UK court tosses class-action style health data misuse claim against Google DeepMind
value.excerpt: Google has prevailed against another U.K. class-action style privacy lawsuit after a London court dismissed a lawsuit filed last year against the tech giant and its AI division, DeepMind ...

value.title: Microsoft Bing AI Chat Widgets: How to Get Them on iOS and Android
value.excerpt: Microsoft launched artificial intelligence-powered search on Bing 100 days ago, celebrating the milestone with a few updates to the system this week. One of those is adding a chatbot widget for phone screens across both iOS and Android.

value.title: High-Stakes: Generative AI Shakes Global Diplomacy At Japan’s 2023 G7 Summit
value.excerpt: The G7 in Japan discussions are focused on the need for regulations to keep up with the rapid advancements in AI. Our goal is to start a global dialogue on the best way to adopt generative AI. It's important to start this conversation now before the AI wave overtakes us.

value.title: Apple looking to hire machine learning engineers with an interest in generative AI
value.excerpt: Apple's Technology Development Group (TDG) is looking for Machine-Learning engineers with a background and/or interest in Generative AI! You will be leveraging innovative Generative models to build fundamental applications on top of Apple's most advanced ...

value.title: Improved CPU throttling measurement
value.excerpt:
IBM Turbonomic now offers a significant improvement in the way that we measure the level of CPU throttling.
The post Improved CPU throttling measurement appeared first on IBM Blog.

value.title: New Meta AI Chip to Power the Metaverse and Create a New Virtual World
value.excerpt: Meta, the parent company of Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp, is developing its own AI chip to power its next-generation AI applications. The chip, called the Meta Training and Inference Accelerator (MTIA),

value.title: Apple is on the hunt for generative AI talent
value.excerpt: Apple currently has a dozen of job postings on its career page to look for experts in the field of generative AI.

value.title: Artists deserve “fairness and control” over AI use, says SoundExchange CEO
value.excerpt: Michael Huppe, CEO of SoundExchange, speaks out about OpenAI CEO Sam Altman's Senate testimony about AI regulation earlier this week.

value.title: China is ramping up efforts to drive AI development
value.excerpt: Tagging artificial intelligence as an important focus for the country, the Chinese government plans to step up efforts in research and development, including the establishment of regional AI industrial hubs.

value.title: Multan airport 4th in country to get Facial Recognition System
value.excerpt: The Multan International Airport has become the fourth in the country to have a functional Facial Recognition System, a Pakistan Civil Aviation Authority spokesperson confirmed Friday. The

value.title: TDC Digital leverages IBM Cloud for transparent billing and improved customer satisfaction
value.excerpt:
IBM Cloud enabled TDC Digital to overcome persistent issues with billing transparency and helped reduce customer complaints by 31%.
